Description: Infinity Insurance Co., Infinity National Insurance Co., and Infinity Select Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $600,000 penalty in settlement of allegations their driver's insurance underwriting practices violated state law.
The Infinity Insurance Companies agreed to pay a $750,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations its handling of claims violated the state Insurance Code and Vehicle Code.

Description: Unitrin reached a $33 million settlement with a group of states to resolve allegations that three of its subsidiaries -- United Insurance Company of America, Reliable Life Insurance Company, and Union National Life Insurance Company -- had in the past engaged in race-based premium practices.
Info Source: UPDATE: UNITRIN AGREES TO SETTLE RACE-BASED CLAIMS, Bestwire, May 2, 2002 (via Nexis).

Description: NASD Regulation, Inc., announced a settlement in which it censured and fined Kemper Distributors, Inc., $100,000 for running inaccurate mutual fund advertisements and for violating other NASD advertising-related rules.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).
